Title:
A chestnut brown Aureoboletus (Boletaceae) from Guangdong of
China
Abstract:
Aureoboletus castaneus sp. nov. is described, illustrated
and compared with phenetically similar and phylogenetically related
species. Morphologically, it is characterized by its small fruitbody,
reddish brown to brownish violet or violet brown, glutinous and wrinkled
pileus with appendiculating gelatinized veil remnants, and basidiospores
(8â“)8.5â“10 Ã 4â“4.5(â“5) Î¼m in size. Phylogenetic analysis of the new
species and related taxa based on large subunit of nuclear ribosomal DNA
(nrLSU) sequences is provided. Morphological and molecular data show
that the new species should be placed in genus Aureoboletus, and it is
clearly different from any known taxon.
